docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 26 -- Secretary General Dog Hammarskjold released today a list of thirty nominees for five seats to be filled this year on the International Court of Justice.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 26 -- Secretary General Dog Hammarskjold released today a list of thirty nominees for five seats to be filled this year on the International Court of Justice.

headline.main: 30 ARE NOMINATED FOR WORLD COURT; Sir Arnold McNair, President, Declines New Term -- U. N. Will Elect Five Judges

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON, Aug. 27 -- The cable ship Recorder, 3,300 tons, newest, largest and fastest vessel of Cable and Wireless Company's fleet, was heading at reduced speed tonight to Gravesend after having been badly damaged in a collision.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 27 -- The cable ship Recorder, 3,300 tons, newest, largest and fastest vessel of Cable and Wireless Company's fleet, was heading at reduced speed tonight to Gravesend after having been badly damaged in a collision.

headline.main: BRITISH CABLE SHIP DAMAGED IN CRASH

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: British sterling suffered a sharp break last week, selling down to $2.80 3/8, on Friday, lowest since October 13, 1953. The setback was linked to seasonal needs of commercial accounts, particularly the oil companies which made heavy demands upon the...
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling suffered a sharp break last week, selling down to $2.80 3/8, on Friday, lowest since October 13, 1953. The setback was linked to seasonal needs of commercial accounts, particularly the oil companies which made heavy demands upon the dollar market in London. It was hinted that there might have been some requisitions by the oil companies representing their consortium obligations.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended August 27, 1954

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 4 -- Uranium is as plentiful as lead in Latin America's subsoil, according to Robert LeBaron, former chairman of the Military Liaison Committee to the United States Atomic Energy Commission.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 4 -- Uranium is as plentiful as lead in Latin America's subsoil, according to Robert LeBaron, former chairman of the Military Liaison Committee to the United States Atomic Energy Commission.

headline.main: URANIUM ABOUNDS IN LATIN AMERICA; U.S. Aide Hopeful of Speeding Industrial Revolution by Use of Nuclear Power

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The Houston Post will publish in January its largest single issue, according to W. Howard Baldwin, vice president and general manager. The issue will commemorate the seventieth anniversary of the newspaper, which also will open a new $4,000,000 plant...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Houston Post will publish in January its largest single issue, according to W. Howard Baldwin, vice president and general manager. The issue will commemorate the seventieth anniversary of the newspaper, which also will open a new $4,000,000 plant as 1955 bows in.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Sept. 3, 1954
GONZALES' 68 SETS PACE; Burkemo, at 73, Leads U. S. Pros in Sao Paulo Golf

docs.snippet: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 10 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg, S. C., shattered par today with a blazing 67, nine under regulation figures, to take the first-round lead in the St. Louis women's open golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 10 (AP) -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg, S. C., shattered par today with a blazing 67, nine under regulation figures, to take the first-round lead in the St. Louis women's open golf tournament.

headline.main: BETSY RAWLS' 67 LEADS BY 5 SHOTS; Her Score in St. Louis Open, Nine Under Women's Par, Is Best of Career

docs.snippet: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 11 -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg, S. C., took a commanding eight-stroke lead today in the St. Louis women's open golf tournament, as she conquered slick greens and a troublesome wind for a three-under-par 73.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS, Sept. 11 -- Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg, S. C., took a commanding eight-stroke lead today in the St. Louis women's open golf tournament, as she conquered slick greens and a troublesome wind for a three-under-par 73.

headline.main: Miss Rawls Retains Links Lead With 140; BETSY RAWLS' 140 LEADS BY 8 SHOTS
